title: WI-001: Initialize Frontend React SPA with Vite and TypeScript
description: Create the React project using Vite's TypeScript template. Configure `vite.config.ts`, `tsconfig.json`, and install core dependencies: React 18+, Redux Toolkit, Material-UI, Styled-components, Jest, RTL, Cypress.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: Project can be started with `npm run dev`. A basic component test passes. ESLint configuration is in place.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; CI job configured.
business_value: Enables all future frontend development.

title: WI-002: Initialize Backend API with NestJS and TypeScript
description: Create the NestJS project using the Nest CLI. Configure `tsconfig.json` and install core dependencies: NestJS framework, PostgreSQL driver (pg), TypeORM, Pino, Jest, Supertest.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: Project can be started with `npm run start:dev`. Default health check endpoint returns 200 OK. ESLint/Prettier is configured.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; CI job configured.
business_value: Enables all future backend development.

title: WI-004: Terraform: Define AWS VPC and Networking
description: Create Terraform configuration for a new VPC, public/private subnets across at least two Availability Zones, NAT Gateways, and Internet Gateway.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: `terraform apply` provisions the network resources successfully. Subnets span at least two AZs. Resources are tagged correctly.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; `terraform apply` successful; Resources verified in AWS Console.
deployment_notes: On critical path for all other infrastructure.
business_value: Creates the foundational secure cloud environment.

title: WI-005: Terraform: Provision PostgreSQL RDS Instance
description: Define an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL (v15+) instance. Configure Multi-AZ, encryption at rest (KMS), automated daily snapshots with 14-day retention, and PITR.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: RDS instance is created with Multi-AZ. Encryption is active. Backup policy is configured per REQ-1-044.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; `terraform apply` successful; RDS instance properties verified in AWS Console.
deployment_notes: On critical path for backend services.
business_value: Provisions the persistent data store for the application.

title: WI-006: Terraform: Set up AWS Secrets Manager and IAM Roles
description: Create Terraform resources for AWS Secrets Manager to store the RDS password. Define an IAM role for the ECS service and Lambda function to grant them read access to these secrets.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: Secret created in Secrets Manager. IAM role created with policy granting read access to the specific secret.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; IAM policies verified for least-privilege.
testing_requirements: Verification of successful secret retrieval from a test instance.
deployment_notes: On critical path for service deployment.
business_value: Secures database credentials and defines service permissions.

title: WI-007: Terraform: Define ECS Cluster, Task Definition, and Service
description: Create Terraform resources for an AWS ECS cluster using Fargate. Define Task Definition and Service for the 'User & Data Service'. Configure the service to run in private subnets across two AZs.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: ECS service deployed and tasks running. Service pulls image from ECR. Tasks are in private subnets with correct IAM role.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; successful `terraform apply`; running tasks verified in ECS console.
deployment_notes: On critical path for backend deployment.
business_value: Provisions the container orchestration platform for the main backend service.

title: WI-008: Terraform: Define Lambda Function for Formula Execution
description: Define the AWS Lambda function resource for the 'Formula Execution Service'. Configure its runtime, memory/timeout limits, and assign the IAM role created in TASK-006.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: Lambda function resource is created. IAM role has minimal permissions. Resource limits are strictly configured per REQ-1-018.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; successful `terraform apply`; resource inspection in AWS Console.
business_value: Provisions the serverless execution environment for custom formulas.

title: WI-010: Terraform: Define AWS Cognito User Pool
description: Create the AWS Cognito User Pool and App Client. Configure the password policy (REQ-1-071) and OAuth 2.0 settings for Authorization Code Flow with PKCE (REQ-1-039).
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: Cognito User Pool created with 12-char password policy. App Client configured for SPA with PKCE enabled.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; successful `terraform apply`; User Pool settings verified in AWS Console.
deployment_notes: On critical path for all authentication features.
business_value: Provisions the managed identity provider for the application.

title: WI-009: Terraform: Define API Gateway
description: Configure an Amazon API Gateway to route requests to the ECS service and the Lambda function. Enable Cognito authorizer for protected routes.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational monorepo and all core AWS infrastructure via Terraform.
acceptance_criteria: API Gateway deployed with routes. Integrations with ECS and Lambda are configured. Cognito authorizer attached to protected endpoints.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed; successful `terraform apply`; API endpoints tested via Postman.
deployment_notes: On critical path as the application entry point.
business_value: Provisions the secure, managed entry point for all application APIs.

title: WI-003: Configure Docker for Backend Service
description: Create a multi-stage `Dockerfile` for the NestJS backend. The build stage compiles TypeScript, and the final stage copies only production artifacts into a minimal Node.js base image.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: `docker build` completes successfully. The container runs locally. Image size is optimized.
definition_of_done: Dockerfile reviewed; `docker build` and `run` commands succeed.
business_value: Containerizes the backend service for portable and consistent deployments.

title: WI-011: GitHub Actions: Create Main CI/CD Workflow Skeleton
description: Create the main workflow YAML file in `.github/workflows`. Configure it to trigger on `push` events. Define placeholder jobs for the key stages: Lint & Test, Security Scan, Build, Deploy.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: A push to a feature branch successfully triggers a new workflow run. The workflow skeleton is committed.
definition_of_done: Workflow file is reviewed; a workflow run is visible in GitHub Actions.
testing_requirements: Manual trigger and verification in GitHub.
business_value: Establishes the automation framework for the entire project.

title: WI-012: GitHub Actions: Implement Lint & Test Stage
description: Configure the 'Lint & Test' job to install dependencies (`npm ci`), run linting (`npm run lint`), and execute all unit/integration tests (`npm test`) for both frontend and backend. Configure the backend test to fail if coverage drops below 85%.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: A broken test or linting error causes the workflow to fail. Backend test coverage dropping below 85% fails the workflow.
definition_of_done: Workflow file updated; pipeline correctly fails on deliberate error injection.
collaboration_required: FE and BE teams for test scripts.
business_value: Automates quality checks for all code changes.

title: WI-013: GitHub Actions: Implement Security Scan Stage
description: Configure the 'Security Scan' job to perform SAST (CodeQL), SCA (`npm audit`), and Container Vulnerability Scanning (Trivy) as required by REQ-1-048.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: SAST, SCA, and Container scans run on every push. Job fails if a new critical vulnerability is found.
definition_of_done: Workflow file updated; scan reports visible in GitHub; build fails on vulnerability injection.
business_value: Automates security checks, reducing risk of deploying vulnerable code.

title: WI-014: GitHub Actions: Implement Build & Deploy Stage
description: Configure the 'Deploy' job for the main branch. This job will build all artifacts, push to ECR, run DB migrations, apply Terraform, and deploy to ECS using Blue/Green.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: A merge to main triggers a full B/G deployment to staging. DB migrations run before traffic shift. Terraform apply uses correct workspace.
definition_of_done: Workflow file updated; a successful, zero-downtime deployment is observed in the staging environment.
deployment_notes: On critical path for all feature releases.
business_value: Automates the entire software release process.

title: WI-015: Frontend: Implement User Registration Component
description: Create the React component for the user registration form. Include fields for email, password, and password confirmation. Implement client-side validation and require acceptance of ToS/Privacy Policy.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: Registration form rendered correctly. Client-side validation errors are displayed. Submit button disabled until valid.
definition_of_done: Component unit tests pass; visual review approved.
business_value: Provides the user interface for account creation.

title: WI-016: Frontend: Implement Cognito Registration Logic
description: Integrate the registration form with the AWS Cognito SDK to handle the user sign-up process. On success, automatically log the user in and redirect to the main app.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: New user can register. Existing email shows error. On success, user is authenticated.
definition_of_done: E2E test for user creation passes.
business_value: Implements the core logic for user account creation.

title: WI-021: Backend: Implement User Account Creation and Sync
description: Create a NestJS service method that, upon a user's first authenticated API call, creates a corresponding record in the local `users` table, linking the Cognito `sub` ID.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: First authenticated API call creates a new entry in `users` table. `auth_provider_id` correctly stores Cognito `sub` claim.
definition_of_done: Integration test verifies user record creation.
business_value: Links the identity provider user with the application's internal database.

title: WI-019: Backend: Implement JWT Validation Guard
description: Create a NestJS Guard that integrates with AWS Cognito to validate incoming JWTs on protected routes. The guard should verify the token and attach the user's claims to the request object.
sprint_goal: Implement the full CI/CD pipeline and the complete user registration flow.
acceptance_criteria: Requests to protected endpoint without valid JWT are rejected with 401. Requests with valid JWT are allowed.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for protected endpoints pass.
business_value: Secures all backend API endpoints.

title: WI-017: Frontend: Implement OAuth 2.0 PKCE Login Flow
description: Implement the login logic that redirects to the Cognito Hosted UI, handling the full PKCE flow: generate challenge, redirect, handle callback, and exchange code for tokens.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: User is redirected to Cognito Hosted UI. App receives auth code. App exchanges code for tokens.
definition_of_done: E2E test successfully logs a user in and obtains JWTs.
business_value: Implements the core secure user login mechanism.

title: WI-018: Frontend: Implement Secure Token Management and Redux State
description: Create a Redux Toolkit slice for auth state. Implement logic to securely store JWTs in-memory, handle token refresh, and configure an Axios interceptor to attach the Bearer token to requests.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Redux store reflects auth status. API calls include Bearer token. App transparently refreshes access token.
definition_of_done: E2E tests verify logged-in user can access protected data and session remains active.
business_value: Enables persistent, secure sessions for authenticated users.

title: WI-020: Backend: Define Database Schema and Migrations with TypeORM
description: Create TypeORM entities for `users`, `custom_modes`, `user_variables`, and `calculation_history` tables. Generate and review the initial database migration scripts.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: TypeORM entities defined. Migration script successfully creates schema matching requirements.
definition_of_done: Migration runs successfully against a blank database.
deployment_notes: On critical path for all data persistence features.
business_value: Defines the data structure for all user-specific persisted data.

title: WI-023: Frontend: Create Main Calculator Layout and Display
description: Implement the main calculator UI using Material-UI. Create a primary display for the current expression/result, and a separate history panel. The layout must be responsive.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Input/result area and history panel are visible. Layout is responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop. Meets WCAG 2.1 AA.
definition_of_done: Visual inspection and accessibility audits pass.
business_value: Creates the primary user interface for the application.

title: WI-025: Frontend: Implement Redux State for Calculator
description: Create a Redux Toolkit slice to manage calculator state: input string, result, history, and angle mode. Define reducers for all basic input actions.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Dispatching actions correctly updates the state in the Redux store. State structure is defined.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for all reducers pass.
business_value: Establishes the client-side state model for the core calculator.

title: WI-024: Frontend: Implement Calculator Keypad Component
description: Create a keypad component with buttons for numbers, basic operators, C, =, and .. Button clicks should dispatch actions to update the Redux state.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Button clicks correctly dispatch actions. Keypad is responsive and accessible.
definition_of_done: Component and E2E tests pass.
business_value: Provides the primary input mechanism for the calculator.

title: WI-027: Frontend: Integrate a Math Expression Parsing Library
description: Select and integrate a library like `math.js`. Create an evaluation service that takes an expression string and returns a result or an error, handling basic arithmetic and order of operations.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: `5+3*2` evaluates to 11. `8/0` is handled gracefully. Decimals and negatives are parsed correctly.
definition_of_done: Extensive unit tests cover all operators, order of operations, and error cases.
deployment_notes: Core calculation engine for the application.
business_value: Implements the 'brain' of the calculator.

title: WI-028: Frontend: Add Scientific Functions to Parser
description: Extend the parsing engine to support all scientific functions required by REQ-1-001: sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan, log, ln, exp, x^y, sqrt, factorial.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: `sin(90)` in DEG mode is 1. `log(100)` is 2. `sqrt(16)` is 4. `5!` is 120. All functions covered by unit tests.
definition_of_done: Unit tests pass for each new function.
business_value: Elevates the calculator from basic to scientific.

title: WI-029: Frontend: Implement Angle Mode Logic (DEG/RAD/GRAD)
description: Implement the UI control to switch between angle modes. The evaluation service must be modified to use the current angle mode for all trigonometric calculations.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: User can cycle through modes. Active mode is displayed. `sin(90)` in DEG is 1. `sin(pi/2)` in RAD is 1. Setting persists in local storage.
definition_of_done: E2E tests verify mode switching and correct calculation results.
business_value: Ensures accuracy of trigonometric calculations.

title: WI-030: Frontend: Implement SI Prefix Parsing
description: Modify the expression parser's tokenizer to recognize and correctly interpret SI prefixes (p, n, μ, m, k, M, G) appended to numbers.
sprint_goal: Deliver the user login flow and core calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: `1k` is 1000. `2.5M` is 2.5e6. `100n` is 1e-7. Parsing is case-sensitive.
definition_of_done: Unit tests cover all prefixes, case-sensitivity, and combinations.
business_value: Greatly improves usability for the target engineering audience.

title: WI-059: Frontend: Implement Account Deletion UI
description: Implement the UI for legal compliance, including the user-initiated account deletion process from their profile page. This includes the multi-step confirmation modal.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: User can initiate deletion. Confirmation modal requires username to confirm. Final delete button enabled only on correct input.
definition_of_done: E2E test of the confirmation flow passes.
business_value: Ensures legal compliance and provides user data control.

title: WI-022: Backend: Implement Account Deletion Service
description: Create a secure API endpoint for account deletion. The service must perform a transactional deletion of the user's data from the application DB (cascading) and then call the Cognito API to delete the user from the User Pool.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint deletes user from Cognito. All associated DB data is deleted. Operation is atomic.
definition_of_done: Integration test proves user and all data are removed from all systems.
business_value: Implements the core logic for the 'Right to be Forgotten'.

title: WI-031: Frontend: Implement User Variable Handling in Parser
description: Extend the parser to recognize variable assignment and usage. The parser must look up variable values from Redux state and validate names against reserved keywords.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: `myVar = 10` is an assignment. `myVar * 2` substitutes value. Undefined variable throws error.
definition_of_done: E2E test: define a variable, then use it in a calculation.
business_value: Enables user-defined variables, a core personalization feature.

title: WI-032: Frontend: Implement Ohm's Law & Power Calculator
description: Create the UI with four input fields (V, I, R, P) and the logic to automatically calculate the two unknown values when any two are provided.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: Entering V=12, R=100 calculates I=0.12, P=1.44. UI provides guidance when input is insufficient.
definition_of_done: Component tests cover all six calculation combinations.
business_value: Provides a core feature for the target electronics audience.

title: WI-033: Frontend: Implement Resistor Combinations Calculator
description: Create a UI that allows a user to build a list of resistor values and calculate the total resistance in Series and Parallel.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: User can manage a list of resistors. A list of [1k, 1k] calculates to 2kΩ (series) and 500Ω (parallel).
definition_of_done: E2E tests verify list management and both calculations.
business_value: Provides a useful tool for circuit designers.

title: WI-034: Frontend: Implement Resistor Color Code Converter
description: Create a two-way converter for resistor color codes (color-to-value and value-to-color) for 3, 4, 5, and 6-band resistors.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: Brown-Black-Red-Gold converts to 1kΩ ±5%. '4.7k' (5-band, 1%) converts to Yellow-Violet-Black-Brown-Brown.
definition_of_done: Component tests cover a matrix of known color/value combinations.
business_value: Provides a convenient utility for identifying physical components.

title: WI-035: Frontend: Implement 555 Timer Design Calculator
description: Implement the UI and logic for both Astable and Monostable 555 timer design modes, including validation for astable duty cycle.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: Astable calculator solves for two unknown components. Monostable solves for one. Duty cycle validation is enforced.
definition_of_done: Component tests cover known-good design values for both modes.
business_value: Provides an advanced design tool for a very common integrated circuit.

title: WI-036: Frontend: Implement Custom Mode Wizard Shell
description: Create the main wizard component with navigation (Next, Back, Cancel) and step indicators. The first step will allow the user to provide a unique name and an optional description.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: User can launch wizard. Wizard displays step indicators. User can enter name and description.
definition_of_done: Component tests and visual inspection pass.
business_value: Creates the UI framework for the custom mode creation feature.

title: WI-037: Frontend: Implement Variable Definition Step
description: Create the UI for the wizard step where users can dynamically add, edit, and delete named input and output variables. Implement real-time validation for variable names.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: User can manage input/output variables. Real-time validation prevents duplicates and invalid names. Wizard requires at least one of each.
definition_of_done: E2E test of adding, editing, and validating variables passes.
business_value: Allows users to define the interface for their custom calculator.

title: WI-038: Frontend: Implement Formula Definition Step with Validation
description: Create the UI for the formula definition step, integrating a code editor component. Implement real-time, client-side validation for syntax and semantics (e.g., use of undefined variables).
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: User can write formulas. Real-time feedback highlights errors. Wizard cannot be saved with invalid formulas.
definition_of_done: E2E test verifies error reporting for various invalid formulas.
business_value: Allows users to define the logic for their custom calculator.

title: WI-039: Backend: Implement CRUD API for Custom Modes
description: In the NestJS service, create the controller, service, and DTOs for full CRUD operations on the `custom_modes` table. All endpoints must be protected and enforce data ownership.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: User can CRUD their own modes. Access to another user's mode is rejected. API is documented via OpenAPI.
definition_of_done: Integration tests cover all CRUD operations and authorization failure cases.
business_value: Provides the backend service for creating and managing all custom modes.

title: WI-040: Backend: Implement Secure Formula Execution Lambda
description: Develop the AWS Lambda function using `isolated-vm` to execute user-defined formulas in a secure, isolated V8 sandbox, as per REQ-1-018 and REQ-1-019.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Lambda executes valid formulas. Use of disallowed functions results in a security error. Adheres to resource limits.
definition_of_done: Unit tests prove that malicious and resource-intensive code is correctly terminated by the sandbox.
business_value: Safely executes untrusted user code, which is the core of the custom mode feature.

title: WI-041: Backend: Implement Custom Mode Execution Endpoint
description: Create an API endpoint that fetches a mode definition, verifies ownership, and invokes the secure Lambda function with the formula and user-provided inputs.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint orchestrates auth -> fetch -> invoke -> return. Returns correct results for valid inputs. Returns structured error on failure.
definition_of_done: Integration test calls the endpoint and mocks the Lambda invocation.
business_value: Connects the main application to the secure formula execution engine.

title: WI-043: Frontend: Implement Custom Mode Launch and Execution UI
description: Create a dynamic UI component that renders a form based on a custom mode's definition. On submission, it calls the execution API endpoint and displays the results.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: UI renders input fields correctly from definition. 'Calculate' calls API and displays results. Backend errors are shown to user.
definition_of_done: E2E test: launch a mode, enter data, and verify the calculated output.
business_value: Provides the user interface for actually using the custom modes they create.

title: WI-042: Frontend: Implement Custom Mode Management Screen
description: Create a UI screen that lists all of the user's custom modes, with controls to Launch, Edit, Delete, and Export each mode.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: User's modes are fetched and displayed. Empty state is shown for new users. Controls for all actions are present.
definition_of_done: E2E test verifies the list is populated correctly.
business_value: Provides the central hub for users to manage their creations.

title: WI-044: Frontend: Implement Export/Import Functionality
description: Implement the file-based sharing mechanism. Export triggers a browser download of a JSON file. Import allows uploading a JSON file, which is sent to the backend for validation and creation.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: User can export a mode to a valid JSON file. User can import a valid file to create a new mode. Invalid files are rejected with an error.
definition_of_done: E2E test: export a mode, delete it, then import the file and verify it's restored.
business_value: Enables sharing and backup of user-created content.

title: WI-045: Frontend: Implement Service Worker for Offline Caching
description: Create and configure a Service Worker to cache the application shell (HTML, CSS, JS bundles), allowing the core calculator to be fully functional offline.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: App can be used while browser is offline. Core calculator functions work offline. Service worker updates correctly on new deployments.
definition_of_done: E2E tests using network control confirm offline functionality.
business_value: Provides a native-like, reliable experience even without internet.

title: WI-046: Frontend: Implement IndexedDB Offline Queue
description: Implement a service that intercepts outgoing API requests when offline and saves the payload to an IndexedDB queue for later processing.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: When offline, save actions are queued in IndexedDB. UI optimistically reflects the change.
definition_of_done: E2E test: go offline, perform an action, inspect IndexedDB to verify the queued item.
business_value: Ensures no data is lost during periods of no connectivity.

title: WI-047: Frontend: Implement Online/Offline Detection and Sync Trigger
description: Implement logic to detect network restoration. When online, process the IndexedDB queue, sending stored requests to the backend.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: On network restoration, queued requests are sent. Successfully synced items are removed from queue. Failed items are retained.
definition_of_done: E2E test: go offline, queue items, go online, verify network requests and queue is cleared.
business_value: Completes the data synchronization loop.

title: WI-048: Backend: Implement 'Last-Write-Wins' Conflict Resolution
description: Modify UPDATE endpoints for mutable data (user variables, custom modes) to implement the 'last-write-wins' strategy based on timestamps, as defined in REQ-1-015.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Update with newer timestamp succeeds. Update with older timestamp is rejected with 409 Conflict and authoritative data.
definition_of_done: Integration tests simulate stale update attempts and assert the 409 response.
business_value: Ensures data consistency for users on multiple devices or with intermittent connectivity.

title: WI-049: Backend: Handle Batch Appends for History
description: Enhance the `POST /api/v1/history` endpoint to accept an array of history items to be appended in a single, transactional operation.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint accepts a JSON array of history items. All items are added in a single transaction.
definition_of_done: Integration test posts an array and verifies all items were created.
business_value: Improves performance of offline history synchronization.

title: WI-050: Frontend: Implement Full Keyboard Navigation
description: Audit and refactor all interactive components to be fully operable via keyboard. Ensure logical focus order, visible focus indicators, and no keyboard traps.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Every element is keyboard accessible. Logical focus order. No keyboard traps. Visible focus indicators.
definition_of_done: Manual E2E testing of the entire application using only a keyboard.
business_value: Ensures the application is usable by people with motor disabilities.

title: WI-051: Frontend: Implement ARIA Roles and Attributes for Screen Readers
description: Audit and refactor all components to use correct semantic HTML and ARIA attributes for screen reader compatibility, including labels, live regions, and roles.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: All controls have accessible names. Dynamic content changes are announced. Custom components use correct ARIA roles.
definition_of_done: Manual testing with screen readers (NVDA, VoiceOver) for all core user flows.
business_value: Ensures the application is usable by visually impaired users.

title: WI-052: Frontend: Enforce Color Contrast Standards
description: Audit the application's color palette and component styles to ensure all text and UI elements meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast ratios.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Axe audit reports no critical contrast violations. All text meets contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1.
definition_of_done: Automated Axe scans are integrated into E2E tests and pass.
business_value: Ensures the application is usable by users with low vision.

title: WI-053: Backend: Implement Structured JSON Logging with Pino
description: Integrate the Pino library into the NestJS application to ensure all log output is structured JSON, including timestamp, log level, and service name.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: All logs are valid JSON objects. Each entry contains timestamp, level, and message.
definition_of_done: Inspect log output in CloudWatch to confirm JSON format.
business_value: Enables effective, machine-readable logging for monitoring and debugging.

title: WI-054: Backend: Implement Correlation ID Propagation
description: Create a NestJS middleware to handle Correlation IDs. Generate one if not present, and include it in all log statements for that request's lifecycle.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: All log entries for a single API request share the same Correlation ID.
definition_of_done: Make an API request and trace all related logs in CloudWatch using the same Correlation ID.
business_value: Enables end-to-end request tracing across distributed services.

title: WI-055: Infrastructure: Configure CloudWatch Alarms
description: Using Terraform, define CloudWatch alarms for API Gateway 5xx errors, P99 API latency, ECS utilization, and Lambda errors, as per REQ-1-068.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: All specified alarms are created via Terraform. Alarm state change publishes a notification to SNS.
definition_of_done: Manually trigger an alarm and verify a notification is received.
business_value: Provides automated monitoring and alerting for production incidents.

title: WI-056: Docs: Set up Docusaurus Project for Help Content
description: Initialize a Docusaurus project within the repository and create the initial content structure with placeholder pages for all required sections.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Docusaurus project created. Site can be built locally. Placeholder pages exist.
definition_of_done: Run the local Docusaurus development server.
business_value: Establishes the framework for all in-app help documentation.

title: WI-057: CI/CD: Integrate Docusaurus Build into Pipeline
description: Add a step to the GitHub Actions workflow to build the Docusaurus static site. The resulting assets should be deployed alongside the main React SPA assets.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: CI/CD pipeline builds Docusaurus site. Assets are deployed to a sub-path.
definition_of_done: Verify help content is accessible at the correct URL after a deployment.
business_value: Automates the deployment of help documentation.

title: WI-058: Frontend: Implement In-App Help Modal
description: Create a React modal that displays the Docusaurus help content. Add a persistent help icon to the main UI that toggles this modal.
sprint_goal: Launch custom modes, deliver offline sync, and complete compliance tasks.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking help icon opens an accessible modal. Help content is displayed correctly inside.
definition_of_done: E2E test opens and closes the help modal.
business_value: Provides a seamless, in-app user support experience.

title: WI-0XX: Backend: Add data persistence for variables and history
description: Implement the backend CRUD endpoints required to persist user variables and calculation history. These are precursors to stories US-055 and US-054.
sprint_goal: Implement data persistence, account deletion, and specialized electronics modes.
acceptance_criteria: Authenticated users can create, read, update, and delete their own variables via API. Authenticated users can create and read their own history items via API.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for all new endpoints are implemented and passing, including authorization checks.
business_value: Provides the backend foundation for all user data persistence features.
